app.revision_history: Modified README; package requirement is Vivado 2013.1; updated commit id
app.name: designutils
app.author: Multiple people
app.summary: This directory is a collection of random scripts and utilties in no particular organization.

proc.name: bisect_pblock
proc.summary: bisect a P block

proc.name: check_cdc_paths
proc.summary: checks all the CDC paths for typical issues

proc.name: clone_cell
proc.summary: Clone a cell and connects all the clone input pins to the master input pins. Run after synthesis

proc.name: clone_net_driver
proc.summary: Clone the driver cell of a net. Run after synthesis

proc.name: create_diff_ports
proc.summary: Creates differential _N port for each _P port in a pinplanning design

proc.name: get_host_platform
proc.summary: return the host platform (windows|unix)

proc.name: get_inter_slr_nets
proc.summary: get all the inter-SLR nets

proc.name: get_leaf_cells
proc.summary: get all the leave cells below an instance

proc.name: get_mem
proc.summary: queries the kernel for current heap memory of Vivado session

proc.name: get_pid_mem
proc.summary: queries the kernel for the heap memory of a specific process

proc.name: get_sll_nets
proc.summary: get routed inter-SLR nets that have a VLONG12 cost and over 100 wire shapes on at least one of its nodes

proc.name: get_sll_nodes
proc.summary: returns all the sll node objects in the device for matching SLRs

proc.name: gets_regexp
proc.summary: returns the next line that matches occurrence of regular expression in the file

proc.name: highlight_enable_signal_sites
proc.summary: highlight the destination sites of the enable signals reported by report_control_set command

proc.name: insert_buffer_chain
proc.summary: insert a list of buffers or any 2-pins cells on a net

proc.name: prettyTable
proc.summary: utility to easily create and print tables

proc.name: read_file_regexp
proc.summary: returns all lines that match occurrence of regular expression in the file

proc.name: reapply_iostandard
proc.summary: this command queries the tool-chosen defaults from implementation and "apply" them so it looks like the user did it from the beginning. This complies with the bit export restriction that all ios be LOCd and explicitly set to an IO Standard

proc.name: replicate_high_fanout_registers
proc.summary: Replicate registers to limit register fanout to maxFan. Run after synthesis

proc.name: report_cells_fanout
proc.summary: report the fanout of cells matching a REF_NAME pattern

proc.name: report_cells_loc
proc.summary: report the location of cells matching a REF_NAME pattern

proc.name: report_critical_hfn
proc.summary: report timing critical high fanout nets based on fanout and slack

proc.name: report_hier_util
proc.summary: report the cell utilization below hierarchical instances

proc.name: report_parts
proc.summary: report all the available parts that match a pattern

proc.name: source_path
proc.summary: source a script from a choice of paths

proc.name: verilog2int
proc.summary: Convert a Verilog formatted number to an integer

proc.name: write_template
proc.summary: generates a Verilog/VHDL stub, instanciation template or testbench for the current design in memory (current_instance)

proc.name: delete
proc.summary: Wrapper around stooop::delete to delete stooop managed object

proc.name: diff_close_designs
proc.summary: This helper command is used to report the sequential line differences between all of the properties of the objects returned from a specific command on each design.

proc.name: diff_lists
proc.summary: This helper command is used to report the non-sequential differences between the lists produced when executing a specific command on each design. In other words, if we ran get_cells on two designs and this is what was returned: design_1: a c d, design_2: c d a. Then diff_lists would say that the lists are equivalent. The diff_lists command *does not care about order*.

proc.name: diff_props
proc.summary: This helper command is used to report the sequential line differences between the reports produced when executing a specific command on each design.

proc.name: diff_reports
proc.summary: This helper command is used to report the sequential line differences between the reports produced when executing a specific command on each design. In other words, if we ran report_clocks -return_string on two designs and this is what was returned: design_1: a b c, design_2: b c a. This helper command is used to report the sequential line differences between all of the properties of the objects returned from a specific command on each design.

proc.name: double_exec
proc.summary: This helper command is used to execute any tcl command on both designs.

proc.name: new_diff
proc.summary: This helper command is used to create a new diff object. This is the object that difference methods can be called on and differences can be reported.

proc.name: new_report
proc.summary: This helper command is used to create a new report object.

app.name: projutils
app.author: Raj Klair
app.summary: This script can be used to write a Tcl script for re-building the current project from the Vivado Tcl shell

proc.name: export_simulation
proc.summary: Generate design filelist for the specified simulator for standalone simulation

proc.name: write_project_tcl
proc.summary: Export Tcl script for re-creating the current project

app.name: tk_tunnel
app.author: Nik Cimino
app.summary: This app can be used to launch a Tcl/Tk 8.5 server using a standalone Tcl shell, and pass commands from Vivado to the Tk shell.

proc.name: accept_connection
proc.summary: This proc is the callback function when the server receives a connection request

proc.name: broadcast
proc.summary: This command broadcasts a command / response to all clients from the server

proc.name: connect_to_server
proc.summary: This proc is called to connect a client to a server, it will wait until it is connected

proc.name: exec_push_return
proc.summary: Executes a command locally and broadcasts the return to the client (called by rexec_wait)

proc.name: launch_server
proc.summary: Starts the server that the Tk commands will be sent to (launched from client)

proc.name: rexec
proc.summary: Executes a command on the Tk server (remote exec)

proc.name: rexec_wait
proc.summary: Executes a command on the Tk server (remote exec), and waits for the response/return

proc.name: socket_event
proc.summary: This proc is called when a socket event occurs

proc.name: start_client
proc.summary: Starts the client that will be sending the Tk commands

proc.name: start_server
proc.summary: This command launches the listening service on the server

proc.name: stdin_event
proc.summary: This proc is called when a stdin event occurs

proc.name: wait
proc.summary: This proc will wait for a specified time

proc.name: wait_for_response
proc.summary: Waits for client_return to be set (called by rexec_wait)
